title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Mr Thomas Reid, farmer, of Hutlerburn, was oneof my father's elders.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Many long years afterwards, when Lord Jerviswoode's son George came to Hutlerburn to residefor a time with the Rev. Mr Cuthbert, he wasaccompanied by an old servant of Mr Scott's (thenLord Polwarth).

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: The one was Mr Thomas Reid, farmer, Hutlerburn, who crossed the Kershope Swire, whateverthe season or weather, for divine service, on foot,and often on a stormy winter's day, when my fatherwould rather he had stayed at home, for he had
